---

## Prompt for Claude Code

```
I want to build a comprehensive interactive CLI tool called "qstash-manager" for managing QStash resources (URL groups, schedules, queues, messages, monitoring, and more).

CONTEXT:
- I already have a working QStash URL groups CLI in my Prefix project at /Users/daniel/development/prefix/src/cli/commands/qstash-url-groups.ts
- I want to extract this into a standalone NPM package that others can use via npx or npm install -g
- The new project should be in /Users/daniel/development/qstash-manager-project (already created)
- My NPM username is: chl03ks
- I'm already logged into NPM CLI

COMPLETE DESIGN:
I have a complete design document at /Users/daniel/development/qstash-manager-project/DESIGN.md that includes:
- Full architecture and project structure
- NPM package configuration
- All features to implement (URL groups, schedules, queues, messages, DLQ, logs, security)
- Interactive-first UX principles
- Testing strategy
- Implementation priorities (5-week plan)

KEY PRINCIPLES:
1. Interactive-first (not command flags) - users navigate menus like an app
2. Never force exit - always allow going back with ‚Üê or Ctrl+C
3. Beautiful UX using @clack/prompts (same as existing code)
4. Multi-environment support (production, staging, dev with token management)
5. Start from scratch but get inspiration from the existing URL groups code
6. Support both npx execution and global install
7. Follow NPM package best practices for publishing

TECH STACK:
- TypeScript (strict mode)
- Commander.js for CLI framework
- @clack/prompts for interactive UI
- @upstash/qstash SDK for API
- tsup for building
- vitest for testing
- Node >= 18

WHAT I NEED YOU TO DO:
1. Read the complete DESIGN.md file to understand the full scope
2. Read my existing URL groups CLI implementation for inspiration
3. Create the initial project structure with all necessary config files
4. Set up NPM package configuration (package.json, tsconfig.json, tsup.config.ts)
5. Implement Phase 1 features (foundation, config management, URL groups adapted from existing code, basic messages and logs)
6. Follow the implementation priorities in DESIGN.md
7. Make it production-ready for NPM publishing

IMPORTANT:
- This is a SEPARATE project from my Prefix codebase
- Remove all Prefix-specific dependencies (Prisma, internal logger, etc.)
- Keep the excellent interactive UX from the existing code
- The CLI should feel delightful to use
- Follow the 5-week implementation plan in DESIGN.md

Start by reading DESIGN.md and the existing qstash-url-groups.ts implementation, then create the project foundation.
```

---

## Quick Start Commands for Future Session

When you're ready to start implementation, run:

```bash
cd /Users/daniel/development/qstash-manager-project

# Show Claude this prompt
cat IMPLEMENTATION_PROMPT.md

# Claude will:
# 1. Read DESIGN.md
# 2. Read your existing URL groups code
# 3. Create project structure
# 4. Implement Phase 1 features
# 5. Set up for NPM publishing
```

---

## Files Already Created

- ‚úÖ `/Users/daniel/development/qstash-manager-project/DESIGN.md` - Complete design document
- ‚úÖ `/Users/daniel/development/qstash-manager-project/IMPLEMENTATION_PROMPT.md` - This file

---

## What Claude Will Build

**Week 1: Foundation**
- Project setup (package.json, tsconfig, tsup, etc.)
- Config manager with environment support
- QStash client wrapper
- Interactive UI utilities
- First-run setup wizard

**Week 2: Core Features**
- URL groups (adapted from your existing code)
- Messages (send, track, cancel)
- Basic logs viewing
- Unit tests

**Week 3-5: Advanced Features**
- Queues management
- Schedules management
- Dead Letter Queue
- Enhanced monitoring
- Complete test coverage
- Documentation
- Ready for NPM publish

---

## Before Starting Implementation

Make sure you have:
- [x] NPM account (username: chl03ks)
- [x] Logged into NPM CLI (`npm login`)
- [x] QStash token for testing (get from https://console.upstash.com/qstash)
- [x] Node 18+ installed
- [x] This design document reviewed and approved

---

## Expected Outcome

After implementation, you'll have:
- ‚úÖ Standalone NPM package: `qstash-manager`
- ‚úÖ Works with: `npx qstash-manager` or `npm i -g qstash-manager`
- ‚úÖ Beautiful interactive CLI for managing all QStash resources
- ‚úÖ Multi-environment support (prod, staging, dev)
- ‚úÖ Comprehensive test coverage
- ‚úÖ Ready to publish to NPM and share with the community

---

## Tips for Implementation Session

1. **Start with reading files:**
   - Read DESIGN.md thoroughly
   - Read existing URL groups implementation
   - Understand the architecture

2. **Use the brainstorming skill if needed:**
   - If you need to clarify any design decisions
   - If you want to explore alternative approaches

3. **Follow the plan:**
   - Stick to the 5-week implementation plan
   - Start with Phase 1 (foundation)
   - Don't skip ahead to advanced features

4. **Test as you go:**
   - Write unit tests for each module
   - Test manually with `npm link`
   - Validate token authentication works

5. **Keep the UX excellent:**
   - Interactive-first design
   - Never force exit
   - Beautiful @clack/prompts
   - Helpful error messages

---

Good luck with the implementation! The design is solid and comprehensive. Just follow the plan and you'll have an amazing CLI tool. üöÄ",

## Analysis Summary

**Task**: Build a comprehensive interactive CLI tool called "qstash-manager" for managing QStash resources as a standalone NPM package.

**Key Observations**:
1. **Scope**: Large - 20+ files across multiple command directories (url-groups, schedules, queues, messages, dlq, logs, security, config), plus library utilities and configuration files
2. **Existing Resources**: Complete DESIGN.md with architecture, code structure, and 5-week implementation plan. Existing URL groups code to reference
3. **External Integration**: Single main integration (QStash API via @upstash/qstash SDK) - well-documented
4. **Infrastructure**: No Docker/DB, but requires NPM package setup and config file management
5. **Knowledge**: @clack/prompts and commander.js patterns - existing code provides examples

discovery ‚Üí requirements ‚Üí research ‚Üí context ‚Üí spec_writing ‚Üí planning ‚Üí validation

- **Test Types**: Unit + Integration tests
- **Security Scan**: Yes (handles API tokens)
- **Staging Deployment**: No (CLI tool, distributed via NPM)

    29‚Üí
    30‚ÜíCreate an **interactive-first CLI tool** that makes managing QStash resources delightful and intuitive. The tool should feel like exploring a well-designed application, not executing commands. Users can navigate freely, never get forced to exit, and have powerful debugging capabilities at their fingertips.
    31‚Üí

    34‚Üí1. **Ngrok Development Workflow** - Quickly update webhook URLs during local development

    37‚Üí4. **Multi-Environment Support** - Seamlessly switch between production, staging, and dev environments

    42‚Üí- **Global install:** `npm install -g qstash-manager` then `qstash-manager`

1. **Existing Code Quality**: The `qstash-url-groups.ts` file (1059 lines) contains production-quality UX patterns that should be preserved and extended

2. **@upstash/qstash API Verified**: All API methods for URL groups, schedules, queues, DLQ are available on the Client object

3. **Code Patterns to Preserve**: Interactive menu loop, back navigation, graceful Ctrl+C handling, spinner wrappers, confirmation dialogs

5. **Node 18+ Required**: For native fetch support (eliminates polyfill needs)

    26‚Üí## Project Overview

    28‚Üí### Vision
    29‚Üí
    30‚ÜíCreate an **interactive-first CLI tool** that makes managing QStash resources delightful and intuitive. The tool should feel like exploring a well-designed application, not executing commands. Users can navigate freely, never get forced to exit, and have powerful debugging capabilities at their fingertips.
    31‚Üí
    32‚Üí### Key Problems Solved
    33‚Üí
    34‚Üí1. **Ngrok Development Workflow** - Quickly update webhook URLs during local development
    35‚Üí2. **Production Debugging** - View logs, failed messages, and retry failures without leaving terminal
    36‚Üí3. **Resource Management** - Manage URL groups, schedules, queues through beautiful interactive menus
    37‚Üí4. **Multi-Environment Support** - Seamlessly switch between production, staging, and dev environments
    38‚Üí
    39‚Üí### Distribution
    40‚Üí
    41‚Üí- **NPX execution:** `npx qstash-manager` (instant, no install)
    42‚Üí- **Global install:** `npm install -g qstash-manager` then `qstash-manager`
    43‚Üí- **Short alias:** `qm` for power users

entries.detail:
1‚Üí# Specification: QStash Manager CLI Tool
     2‚Üí
     3‚Üí## Overview
     4‚Üí
     5‚ÜíBuild `qstash-manager`, a standalone NPM CLI tool for comprehensive management of QStash resources including URL groups, schedules, queues, messages, Dead Letter Queue (DLQ), and monitoring. The tool will be extracted from an existing working implementation in the Prefix project, removing all Prefix-specific dependencies while preserving the excellent interactive UX. The CLI will be published to NPM for public use via `npx qstash-manager` or global installation.
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üí## Workflow Type
     8‚Üí
     9‚Üí**Type**: feature
    10‚Üí
    11‚Üí**Rationale**: This is a new standalone project being built from scratch, though adapting patterns from existing code. It involves creating a complete NPM package with multiple features, configuration management, and a full interactive CLI interface. The scope spans multiple weeks of development with phased feature delivery.
    12‚Üí
    13‚Üí## Task Scope
    14‚Üí
    15‚Üí### Services Involved
    16‚Üí- **qstash-manager** (primary) - New standalone NPM CLI package
    17‚Üí
    18‚Üí### This Task Will:
    19‚Üí- [ ] Create complete NPM package structure with TypeScript, tsup, and vitest configuration
    20‚Üí- [ ] Implement config manager with multi-environment token storage (~/.qstash-manager/config.json)
    21‚Üí- [ ] Build QStash client wrapper around @upstash/qstash SDK
    22‚Üí- [ ] Create interactive UI utilities using @clack/prompts
    23‚Üí- [ ] Implement first-run setup wizard for new users
    24‚Üí- [ ] Build URL groups management (adapted from existing Prefix code)
    25‚Üí- [ ] Implement messages functionality (send, track, cancel)
    26‚Üí- [ ] Add basic logs viewing capability
    27‚Üí- [ ] Build queues management (list, create, pause/resume, delete)
    28‚Üí- [ ] Build schedules management (list, create, pause/resume, delete)
    29‚Üí- [ ] Implement Dead Letter Queue management (list, retry, delete)
    30‚Üí- [ ] Add signing keys management
    31‚Üí- [ ] Write unit and integration tests
    32‚Üí- [ ] Configure for NPM publishing
    33‚Üí
    34‚Üí### Out of Scope:
    35‚Üí- Web UI companion application
    36‚Üí- Desktop notifications
    37‚Üí- Plugin system
    38‚Üí- AI-powered error diagnosis
    39‚Üí- Historical trends and charts
    40‚Üí- Any integration with Prefix codebase after extraction
    41‚Üí
    42‚Üí## Service Context
    43‚Üí
    44‚Üí### qstash-manager
    45‚Üí
    46‚Üí**Tech Stack:**
    47‚Üí- Language: TypeScript (strict mode, ES2022)
    48‚Üí- Framework: Commander.js (CLI), @clack/prompts (interactive UI)
    49‚Üí- API Client: @upstash/qstash SDK
    50‚Üí- Tables: cli-table3
    51‚Üí- Colors: picocolors
    52‚Üí- Build: tsup (with shebang banner)
    53‚Üí- Testing: vitest
    54‚Üí- Key directories: `src/commands/`, `src/lib/`, `src/types/`
    55‚Üí
    56‚Üí**Entry Point:** `src/index.ts`
    57‚Üí
    58‚Üí**How to Run:**
    59‚Üí```bash
    60‚Üí# Development
    61‚Üínpm run dev           # Watch mode with auto-restart
    62‚Üínpm run build         # Build for production
    63‚Üí
    64‚Üí# Testing locally
    65‚Üínpm link              # Link local package
    66‚Üíqstash-manager        # Test the CLI
    67‚Üínpm unlink            # Unlink when done
    68‚Üí
    69‚Üí# After publishing
    70‚Üínpx qstash-manager    # Run without install
    71‚Üínpm i -g qstash-manager && qstash-manager  # Global install
    72‚Üí```
    73‚Üí
    74‚Üí**Port:** N/A (CLI tool, no server)
    75‚Üí
    76‚Üí**Distribution:**
    77‚Üí- Package name: `qstash-manager`
    78‚Üí- Short alias: `qm`
    79‚Üí- NPM username: `chl03ks`
    80‚Üí
    81‚Üí## Files to Modify
    82‚Üí
    83‚ÜíThis is a greenfield project. Files will be created, not modified.
    84‚Üí
    85‚Üí## Files to Reference
    86‚Üí
    87‚ÜíThese files show patterns to follow:
    88‚Üí
    89‚Üí| File | Pattern to Copy |
    90‚Üí|------|----------------|
    91‚Üí| `/Users/daniel/development/prefix/src/cli/commands/qstash-url-groups.ts` | Complete interactive CLI pattern with @clack/prompts, menu navigation, error handling, URL validation |
    92‚Üí| `/Users/daniel/development/qstash-manager-project/DESIGN.md` | Full architecture, project structure, NPM configuration, feature breakdown |
    93‚Üí
    94‚Üí## Patterns to Follow
    95‚Üí
    96‚Üí### Interactive Menu Pattern
    97‚Üí
    98‚ÜíFrom `qstash-url-groups.ts`:
    99‚Üí
   100‚Üí```typescript
   101‚Üí// Menu options with hints
   102‚Üíconst menuOptions: Array<{ value: MenuAction; label: string; hint: string }> = [
   103‚Üí  {
   104‚Üí    value: 'explore',
   105‚Üí    label: 'üîç Explore URL Groups',
   106‚Üí    hint: groupCount > 0 ? 'View and manage existing groups' : 'No groups to explore yet',
   107‚Üí  },
   108‚Üí  {
   109‚Üí    value: 'exit',
   110‚Üí    label: 'üëã Exit',
   111‚Üí    hint: 'Close the manager',
   112‚Üí  },
   113‚Üí];
   114‚Üí
   115‚Üíconst action = await select<MenuAction>('What would you like to do?', menuOptions);
   116‚Üí```
   117‚Üí
   118‚Üí**Key Points:**
   119‚Üí- Always include emoji prefixes for quick scanning
   120‚Üí- Provide contextual hints based on current state
   121‚Üí- Include back/exit options in every menu
   122‚Üí- Use type-safe menu actions with TypeScript
   123‚Üí
   124‚Üí### Continuous Navigation Loop
   125‚Üí
   126‚ÜíFrom `qstash-url-groups.ts`:
   127‚Üí
   128‚Üí```typescript
   129‚Üí// Interactive mode - continuous exploration
   130‚Üíwhile (this.shouldContinue) {
   131‚Üí  try {
   132‚Üí    await this.showMainMenu();
   133‚Üí  } catch (error) {
   134‚Üí    if (error instanceof Error && error.message.includes('User cancelled')) {
   135‚Üí      cliLogger.warning('\nOperation cancelled');
   136‚Üí      this.shouldContinue = false;
   137‚Üí    } else {
   138‚Üí      throw error;
   139‚Üí    }
   140‚Üí  }
   141‚Üí}
   142‚Üí```
   143‚Üí
   144‚Üí**Key Points:**
   145‚Üí- Never force exit - always loop back to menu
   146‚Üí- Handle Ctrl+C gracefully (check for 'User cancelled')
   147‚Üí- Set `shouldContinue = false` only when user explicitly exits
   148‚Üí
   149‚Üí### URL Validation Pattern
   150‚Üí
   151‚ÜíFrom `qstash-url-groups.ts`:
   152‚Üí
   153‚Üí```typescript
   154‚Üíprivate validateUrl(url: string): { isValid: boolean; error?: string } {
   155‚Üí  if (!url) {
   156‚Üí    return { isValid: false, error: 'URL is required' };
   157‚Üí  }
   158‚Üí
   159‚Üí  try {
   160‚Üí    const parsedUrl = new URL(url);
   161‚Üí    if (parsedUrl.protocol !== 'https:') {
   162‚Üí      return {
   163‚Üí        isValid: false,
   164‚Üí        error: 'QStash requires HTTPS URLs (use ngrok for local development)',
   165‚Üí      };
   166‚Üí    }
   167‚Üí    return { isValid: true };
   168‚Üí  } catch {
   169‚Üí    return { isValid: false, error: 'Invalid URL format' };
   170‚Üí  }
   171‚Üí}
   172‚Üí```
   173‚Üí
   174‚Üí**Key Points:**
   175‚Üí- QStash requires HTTPS URLs only
   176‚Üí- Return structured validation result with error message
   177‚Üí- Provide actionable hints (e.g., "use ngrok")
   178‚Üí
   179‚Üí### Error Handling Pattern
   180‚Üí
   181‚ÜíFrom `qstash-url-groups.ts`:
   182‚Üí
   183‚Üí```typescript
   184‚Üíprivate handleApiError(error: unknown, context: string): string {
   185‚Üí  if (error instanceof Error) {
   186‚Üí    if (error.message.includes('401') || error.message.includes('Unauthorized')) {
   187‚Üí      return `Authentication failed. Please check your QSTASH_TOKEN environment variable.`;
   188‚Üí    }
   189‚Üí    if (error.message.includes('404') || error.message.includes('Not Found')) {
   190‚Üí      return `${context}: Resource not found. The URL group may not exist.`;
   191‚Üí    }
   192‚Üí    if (error.message.includes('429') || error.message.includes('Too Many Requests')) {
   193‚Üí      return `Rate limit exceeded. Please wait a moment and try again.`;
   194‚Üí    }
   195‚Üí    return `${context}: ${error.message}`;
   196‚Üí  }
   197‚Üí  return `${context}: ${String(error)}`;
   198‚Üí}
   199‚Üí```
   200‚Üí
   201‚Üí**Key Points:**

## ‚úÖ Planning Session Complete

I have completed the planning phase for the **QStash Manager CLI Tool**. Here's what was created:

### Files Created

| File | Purpose |
|------|---------|
| `implementation_plan.json` | Complete 12-phase, 26-subtask implementation plan |
| `project_index.json` | Service configuration and tech stack |
| `context.json` | File references, patterns, and constraints |
| `init.sh` | Environment setup script (executable) |
| `build-progress.txt` | Progress tracking document |

### Implementation Plan Summary

| Phase | Name | Subtasks | Key Deliverables |
|-------|------|----------|------------------|
| 1 | Project Foundation | 5 | package.json, tsconfig, tsup, vitest configs |
| 2 | Core Libraries | 5 | Config manager, QStash client, UI utilities |
| 3 | CLI Entry & Setup | 3 | Main menu, setup wizard, config commands |
| 4 | URL Groups | 5 | Full URL groups management (from Prefix) |
| 5 | Messages | 2 | Send, track, cancel messages |
| 6 | Logs | 1 | Basic logs viewing with filtering |
| 7 | Queues | 1 | Queue management with parallelism |
| 8 | Schedules | 1 | Schedule management with cron |
| 9 | DLQ | 1 | Dead Letter Queue management |
| 10 | Security | 1 | Signing keys viewing/rotation |
| 11 | Testing | 3 | Unit, integration, E2E tests |
| 12 | Publishing | 3 | README, npm link, final verification |

### Implementation Timeline

- **Week 1**: Phases 1-3 (Foundation, Core Libraries, Entry Point)
- **Week 2**: Phases 4-6 (URL Groups, Messages, Logs)  
- **Weeks 3-4**: Phases 7-9 (Queues, Schedules, DLQ)
- **Week 5**: Phases 10-12 (Security, Testing, Publishing)

### Key Reference Files

The coder agent should reference these files during implementation:

1. **`/Users/daniel/development/prefix/src/cli/commands/qstash-url-groups.ts`** - Complete interactive CLI pattern with:
   - Continuous navigation loop (`while (this.shouldContinue)`)
   - @clack/prompts usage patterns
   - URL validation requiring HTTPS
   - Error handling translating 401/404/429 to user messages
   - Type-safe menu actions

2. **`/Users/daniel/development/qstash-manager-project/DESIGN.md`** - Full architecture spec

### Next Steps

A **coder agent** should:
1. Read `implementation_plan.json` for the subtask list
2. Start with **phase-1-setup** ‚Üí **subtask-1-1** (Create package.json)
3. Work through subtasks sequentially, respecting phase dependencies
4. Verify each subtask before marking complete

**Note**: All spec files are gitignored and stay local - only code changes should be committed.

1‚Üí# Specification: QStash Manager CLI Tool
     2‚Üí
     3‚Üí## Overview
     4‚Üí
     5‚ÜíBuild `qstash-manager`, a standalone NPM CLI tool for comprehensive management of QStash resources including URL groups, schedules, queues, messages, Dead Letter Queue (DLQ), and monitoring. The tool will be extracted from an existing working implementation in the Prefix project, removing all Prefix-specific dependencies while preserving the excellent interactive UX. The CLI will be published to NPM for public use via `npx qstash-manager` or global installation.
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üí## Workflow Type
     8‚Üí
     9‚Üí**Type**: feature
    10‚Üí
    11‚Üí**Rationale**: This is a new standalone project being built from scratch, though adapting patterns from existing code. It involves creating a complete NPM package with multiple features, configuration management, and a full interactive CLI interface. The scope spans multiple weeks of development with phased feature delivery.
    12‚Üí
    13‚Üí## Task Scope
    14‚Üí
    15‚Üí### Services Involved
    16‚Üí- **qstash-manager** (primary) - New standalone NPM CLI package
    17‚Üí
    18‚Üí### This Task Will:
    19‚Üí- [ ] Create complete NPM package structure with TypeScript, tsup, and vitest configuration
    20‚Üí- [ ] Implement config manager with multi-environment token storage (~/.qstash-manager/config.json)
    21‚Üí- [ ] Build QStash client wrapper around @upstash/qstash SDK
    22‚Üí- [ ] Create interactive UI utilities using @clack/prompts
    23‚Üí- [ ] Implement first-run setup wizard for new users
    24‚Üí- [ ] Build URL groups management (adapted from existing Prefix code)
    25‚Üí- [ ] Implement messages functionality (send, track, cancel)
    26‚Üí- [ ] Add basic logs viewing capability
    27‚Üí- [ ] Build queues management (list, create, pause/resume, delete)
    28‚Üí- [ ] Build schedules management (list, create, pause/resume, delete)
    29‚Üí- [ ] Implement Dead Letter Queue management (list, retry, delete)
    30‚Üí- [ ] Add signing keys management
    31‚Üí- [ ] Write unit and integration tests
    32‚Üí- [ ] Configure for NPM publishing
    33‚Üí
    34‚Üí### Out of Scope:
    35‚Üí- Web UI companion application
    36‚Üí- Desktop notifications
    37‚Üí- Plugin system
    38‚Üí- AI-powered error diagnosis
    39‚Üí- Historical trends and charts
    40‚Üí- Any integration with Prefix codebase after extraction
    41‚Üí
    42‚Üí## Service Context
    43‚Üí
    44‚Üí### qstash-manager
    45‚Üí
    46‚Üí**Tech Stack:**
    47‚Üí- Language: TypeScript (strict mode, ES2022)
    48‚Üí- Framework: Commander.js (CLI), @clack/prompts (interactive UI)
    49‚Üí- API Client: @upstash/qstash SDK
    50‚Üí- Tables: cli-table3
    51‚Üí- Colors: picocolors
    52‚Üí- Build: tsup (with shebang banner)
    53‚Üí- Testing: vitest
    54‚Üí- Key directories: `src/commands/`, `src/lib/`, `src/types/`
    55‚Üí
    56‚Üí**Entry Point:** `src/index.ts`
    57‚Üí
    58‚Üí**How to Run:**
    59‚Üí```bash
    60‚Üí# Development
    61‚Üínpm run dev           # Watch mode with auto-restart
    62‚Üínpm run build         # Build for production
    63‚Üí
    64‚Üí# Testing locally
    65‚Üínpm link              # Link local package
    66‚Üíqstash-manager        # Test the CLI
    67‚Üínpm unlink            # Unlink when done
    68‚Üí
    69‚Üí# After publishing
    70‚Üínpx qstash-manager    # Run without install
    71‚Üínpm i -g qstash-manager && qstash-manager  # Global install
    72‚Üí```
    73‚Üí
    74‚Üí**Port:** N/A (CLI tool, no server)
    75‚Üí
    76‚Üí**Distribution:**
    77‚Üí- Package name: `qstash-manager`
    78‚Üí- Short alias: `qm`
    79‚Üí- NPM username: `chl03ks`
    80‚Üí
    81‚Üí## Files to Modify
    82‚Üí
    83‚ÜíThis is a greenfield project. Files will be created, not modified.
    84‚Üí
    85‚Üí## Files to Reference
    86‚Üí
    87‚ÜíThese files show patterns to follow:
    88‚Üí
    89‚Üí| File | Pattern to Copy |
    90‚Üí|------|----------------|
    91‚Üí| `/Users/daniel/development/prefix/src/cli/commands/qstash-url-groups.ts` | Complete interactive CLI pattern with @clack/prompts, menu navigation, error handling, URL validation |
    92‚Üí| `/Users/daniel/development/qstash-manager-project/DESIGN.md` | Full architecture, project structure, NPM configuration, feature breakdown |
    93‚Üí
    94‚Üí## Patterns to Follow
    95‚Üí
    96‚Üí### Interactive Menu Pattern
    97‚Üí
    98‚ÜíFrom `qstash-url-groups.ts`:
    99‚Üí
   100‚Üí```typescript
   101‚Üí// Menu options with hints
   102‚Üíconst menuOptions: Array<{ value: MenuAction; label: string; hint: string }> = [
   103‚Üí  {
   104‚Üí    value: 'explore',
   105‚Üí    label: 'üîç Explore URL Groups',
   106‚Üí    hint: groupCount > 0 ? 'View and manage existing groups' : 'No groups to explore yet',
   107‚Üí  },
   108‚Üí  {
   109‚Üí    value: 'exit',
   110‚Üí    label: 'üëã Exit',
   111‚Üí    hint: 'Close the manager',
   112‚Üí  },
   113‚Üí];
   114‚Üí
   115‚Üíconst action = await select<MenuAction>('What would you like to do?', menuOptions);
   116‚Üí```
   117‚Üí
   118‚Üí**Key Points:**
   119‚Üí- Always include emoji prefixes for quick scanning
   120‚Üí- Provide contextual hints based on current state
   121‚Üí- Include back/exit options in every menu
   122‚Üí- Use type-safe menu actions with TypeScript
   123‚Üí
   124‚Üí### Continuous Navigation Loop
   125‚Üí
   126‚ÜíFrom `qstash-url-groups.ts`:
   127‚Üí
   128‚Üí```typescript
   129‚Üí// Interactive mode - continuous exploration
   130‚Üíwhile (this.shouldContinue) {
   131‚Üí  try {
   132‚Üí    await this.showMainMenu();
   133‚Üí  } catch (error) {
   134‚Üí    if (error instanceof Error && error.message.includes('User cancelled')) {
   135‚Üí      cliLogger.warning('\nOperation cancelled');
   136‚Üí      this.shouldContinue = false;
   137‚Üí    } else {
   138‚Üí      throw error;
   139‚Üí    }
   140‚Üí  }
   141‚Üí}
   142‚Üí```
   143‚Üí
   144‚Üí**Key Points:**
   145‚Üí- Never force exit - always loop back to menu
   146‚Üí- Handle Ctrl+C gracefully (check for 'User cancelled')
   147‚Üí- Set `shouldContinue = false` only when user explicitly exits
   148‚Üí
   149‚Üí### URL Validation Pattern
   150‚Üí
   151‚ÜíFrom `qstash-url-groups.ts`:
   152‚Üí
   153‚Üí```typescript
   154‚Üíprivate validateUrl(url: string): { isValid: boolean; error?: string } {
   155‚Üí  if (!url) {
   156‚Üí    return { isValid: false, error: 'URL is required' };
   157‚Üí  }
   158‚Üí
   159‚Üí  try {
   160‚Üí    const parsedUrl = new URL(url);
   161‚Üí    if (parsedUrl.protocol !== 'https:') {
   162‚Üí      return {
   163‚Üí        isValid: false,
   164‚Üí        error: 'QStash requires HTTPS URLs (use ngrok for local development)',
   165‚Üí      };
   166‚Üí    }
   167‚Üí    return { isValid: true };
   168‚Üí  } catch {
   169‚Üí    return { isValid: false, error: 'Invalid URL format' };
   170‚Üí  }
   171‚Üí}
   172‚Üí```
   173‚Üí
   174‚Üí**Key Points:**
   175‚Üí- QStash requires HTTPS URLs only
   176‚Üí- Return structured validation result with error message
   177‚Üí- Provide actionable hints (e.g., "use ngrok")
   178‚Üí
   179‚Üí### Error Handling Pattern
   180‚Üí
   181‚ÜíFrom `qstash-url-groups.ts`:
   182‚Üí
   183‚Üí```typescript
   184‚Üíprivate handleApiError(error: unknown, context: string): string {
   185‚Üí  if (error instanceof Error) {
   186‚Üí    if (error.message.includes('401') || error.message.includes('Unauthorized')) {
   187‚Üí      return `Authentication failed. Please check your QSTASH_TOKEN environment variable.`;
   188‚Üí    }
   189‚Üí    if (error.message.includes('404') || error.message.includes('Not Found')) {
   190‚Üí      return `${context}: Resource not found. The URL group may not exist.`;
   191‚Üí    }
   192‚Üí    if (error.message.includes('429') || error.message.includes('Too Many Requests')) {
   193‚Üí      return `Rate limit exceeded. Please wait a moment and try again.`;
   194‚Üí    }
   195‚Üí    return `${context}: ${error.message}`;
   196‚Üí  }
   197‚Üí  return `${context}: ${String(error)}`;
   198‚Üí}
   199‚Üí```
   200‚Üí
   201‚Üí**Key Points:**
   202‚Üí- Translate API error codes to user-friendly messages
   203‚Üí- Include actionable guidance
   204‚Üí- Always include context parameter for clarity
   205‚Üí
   206‚Üí### Spinner for Async Operations
   207‚Üí
   208‚ÜíFrom `qstash-url-groups.ts`:
   209‚Üí
   210‚Üí```typescript
   211‚Üíconst groups = await spinner('Loading URL groups...', async () => {
   212‚Üí  return await this.qstashClient.urlGroups.list();
   213‚Üí});
   214‚Üí```
   215‚Üí
   216‚Üí**Key Points:**
   217‚Üí- Always show spinner for network operations
   218‚Üí- Use descriptive loading messages
   219‚Üí- Return data from the spinner callback
   220‚Üí
   221‚Üí## Requirements
   222‚Üí
   223‚Üí### Functional Requirements
   224‚Üí
   225‚Üí1. **First-Run Setup Wizard**
   226‚Üí   - Description: Guides new users through initial configuration with environment name and QStash token
   227‚Üí   - Acceptance: New users can complete setup in under 2 minutes; token is validated before saving
   228‚Üí
   229‚Üí2. **Multi-Environment Configuration**
   230‚Üí   - Description: Store multiple QStash tokens (production, staging, dev) with easy switching
   231‚Üí   - Acceptance: Users can add, remove, switch, and set default environments; config persists in ~/.qstash-manager/config.json
   232‚Üí
   233‚Üí3. **URL Groups Management**
   234‚Üí   - Description: List, create, explore, add/remove endpoints, quick-update (ngrok workflow), delete groups
   235‚Üí   - Acceptance: All URL group operations work; quick-update takes <30 seconds
   236‚Üí
   237‚Üí4. **Messages Management**
   238‚Üí   - Description: Send messages to URL/URL group/queue, track message status, cancel pending messages
   239‚Üí   - Acceptance: Can send test messages with custom headers/delay; can track and cancel messages
   240‚Üí
   241‚Üí5. **Queues Management**
   242‚Üí   - Description: List, create, pause/resume, delete queues; configure parallelism (1-100)
   243‚Üí   - Acceptance: All queue CRUD operations work; can enqueue test messages
   244‚Üí
   245‚Üí6. **Schedules Management**
   246‚Üí   - Description: List, create with cron expression, pause/resume, delete schedules
   247‚Üí   - Acceptance: Cron presets work (hourly, daily, weekly); can preview next 5 scheduled runs
   248‚Üí
   249‚Üí7. **Dead Letter Queue Management**
   250‚Üí   - Description: List failed messages, view failure details, retry single/bulk, delete from DLQ
   251‚Üí   - Acceptance: Can identify and retry failed messages; bulk operations work
   252‚Üí
   253‚Üí8. **Logs & Monitoring**
   254
